basics.name: Ahmet Cecen
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary:
Versatile programmer looking for a full time position around Summer/Fall 2017. Uncanny ability and enthusiasm to assimilate, adapt and build on existing code and concepts in pretty much any language and project that piques my interest.
Currently pursuing a PhD in Computational Science and Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology. I have been doing research and heavily programming in the fields of computational materials science and materials informatics for the past 7 years. My current research focus is on leveraging statistical analysis and machine learning tools to solve big data analytics problems in materials science.

work.summary: Primary research role towards a PhD degree, under the advisement of Dr. Surya R. Kalidindi
highlights: Develop and implement process-structure-property relation schemes using image/signal processing tools, statistical analysis and machine learning paradigms.
Design, implement and publish efficient algorithms for image processing, statistical analysis and visualization of 2D/3D microstructure data.
Design, adapt or opinionate online tools to facilitate the automation, accesibilty and exposure of research data and findings.

work.company: Georgia Tech - School of Public Policy
work.summary: Secondary research role to gain application area breadth, under the advisement of Dr. Julia Melkers
highlights: Tailor big data analysis and machine learning tools to develop filters that resolve name disambiguation in the web of science publication index.

work.summary: Primary research role as an undergraduate research assistant, under the advisement of Dr. Surya R. Kalidindi
highlights: Develop and implement process-structure-property relation schemes using image/signal processing tools, statistical analysis and machine learning paradigms.

work.summary: Primary research role as an undergraduate research assistant, under the advisement of Dr. Emin C. Kumbur
highlights: Develop and implement physical models to capture desired structural parameters and effective properties from measured microstructure samples of PEFCs.

education.thesis: Microstructure Analytics: Exploration, Evolution, Linkages & Reconstructions
Design and Manufacturing of an Automated Electrochemical Flow Capacitor Test Station

awards.title: Materials Science and Engineering Data Challenge - Runner Up
awards.awarder: Air Force Research Lab in partnership with NIST and NSF
awards.summary: Awarded for novel use of accessible digital data to advance Materials Science and Engineering knowledge to accelerate the transition to industrial applications.
